title: Full Stack Engineer, Large User Onboarding
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Large User Onboarding builds the UIs and backend systems to onboard Stripe’s largest users. That includes gathering compliance and risk information, configuring accounts, and generally making sure that account setup is a fast and delightful experience. The optimal onboarding experience for our largest users is very different from the optimal experience for startups and SMBs, and it’s this team’s job to define and build the experience that sets the bar for onboarding the world’s biggest companies.
What you’ll do
Much of what Large User Onboarding does is zero-to-one work, not the work of growing and maintaining an already-mature system. So you’ll be an early, pivotal member of the team building the new flows that define large users’ first experience with Stripe’s products. The shape of those flows is not predetermined. You’ll play an active role in shaping them by continuously talking to users and to Sales team members, and then using that detailed knowledge to polish every corner of the user experience.
Responsibilities
Build end-to-end onboarding experiences tailored to Stripe's largest customers like Amazon and Ford.
Work closely with designers, UX researchers, product managers, members of Stripe’s Sales and Ops teams.
Talk to Stripe's largest users, deeply understand their experience, and use your expertise to make your projects surprisingly great.
Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements
2+ years of experience building delightful user-facing products
Experience leading your work all the way from scoping through launch. 
Comfort moving forward under uncertainty and iterating as you go. You will exercise a lot of ownership and will routinely make important, user-facing decisions about your product.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, especially in explaining an open question and laying out the path forward.
You work unusually quickly.
Preferred qualifications
This role is 70% backend, 30% frontend. Enthusiasm about UI work is required, but experience in it is not as long as you’re willing to learn
You’ve started your own company (including side businesses) or worked in the very early stages of a high-growth startup

questions.label: Please select the country where you currently reside.
Please select the country or countries you anticipate working in for the role in which you are applying.
Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.

questions.description: Please note this role is open to Seattle, SF, NYC, or Chicago only.
questions.label: What office locations are you open to working out of?

values.label: I'm currently within 75 miles of one of our Stripe offices (Seattle, SF, NYC, or Chicago) and plan to work from one of our Stripe offices.
I'm not currently within 75 miles of a Stripe office but I'm open to relocate and work in-office.
I'm only open to remote roles or I'm not located close to one of our offices (Seattle, SF, NYC, or Chicago) and I am not interested in working out of one of the Stripe offices now or in the future.
